biweekly.util.com.google.ical.util

Class TimeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.util.com.google.ical.util.TimeUtils

  • public class TimeUtils
extends Object
    Utility methods for working with times and dates.
    Author:
    Neal Gafter, Michael Angstadt

                              int month1,
                              int day1,
                              int year2,

                              int day2)
        Calculates the number of days between two dates.
        Parameters:
        year1 - the year of the first date
        month1 - the month of the first date
        day1 - the day of the first date
        year2 - the year of the second date
        month2 - the month of the second date
        day2 - the day of the second date
        Returns:
        the number of days

      • fixedFromGregorian

        public static int fixedFromGregorian(int year,
                                     int month,
                                     int day)

        Calculates the number of days since the epoch.

        This is the imaginary beginning of year zero in a hypothetical backward extension of the Gregorian calendar through time. See "Calendrical Calculations" by Reingold and Dershowitz.

        Parameters:
        year - the year of the date to start from
        month - the month of the date to start from
        day - the day of the date to start from
        Returns:
        the number of days

      • isLeapYear

        public static boolean isLeapYear(int year)
        Determines if a year is a leap year.
        Parameters:
        year - the year
        Returns:
        true if it's a leap year, false if not

      • yearLength

        public static int yearLength(int year)
        Determines how many days are in a year.
        Parameters:
        year - the year
        Returns:
        the number of days

      • monthLength

        public static int monthLength(int year,
                              int month)
        Calculates the number of days in a month.
        Parameters:
        year - the year
        month - the month (in range [1,12])
        Returns:
        the number of days

      • timeFromSecsSinceEpoch

        public static DateTimeValue timeFromSecsSinceEpoch(long secsSinceEpoch)
        Computes the gregorian time from the number of seconds since the Proleptic Gregorian Epoch. See "Calendrical Calculations", Reingold and Dershowitz.
        Parameters:
        secsSinceEpoch - the number of seconds since the epoch
        Returns:
        the gregorian time

      • secsSinceEpoch

        public static long secsSinceEpoch(DateValue date)
        Computes the number of seconds from the Proleptic Gregorian epoch to the given time. See "Calendrical Calculations", Reingold and Dershowitz.
        Parameters:
        date - the date
        Returns:
        the number of seconds

      • dayStart

        public static DateTimeValue dayStart(DateValue date)
        Builds a date-time value that represents the start of the given day (all time components set to 0).
        Parameters:
        date - the day
        Returns:
        the date-time value

      • toDateValue

        public static DateValue toDateValue(DateValue date)
        Converts the given date to a DateValue object if it is a TimeValue instance. If it is not a TimeValue instance, then the same date object is returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        date - the date
        Returns:
        the date value

      • timeZoneForName

        public static TimeZone timeZoneForName(String tzString)
        Returns the timezone with the given name or null if no such timezone.
        Parameters:
        tzString - the timezone name (e.g. "America/New_York")
        Returns:
        the timezone or null if no such timezone exists

      • toDateTimeValue

        public static DateTimeValue toDateTimeValue(long millisFromEpoch,
                                            TimeZone zone)
        Builds a DateTimeValue object from the given data.
        Parameters:
        millisFromEpoch - the number of milliseconds from the epoch
        zone - the timezone the number of milliseconds is in
        Returns:
        the DateTimeValue object

      • timeOf

        public static TimeValue timeOf(DateValue date)
        Gets the time component of a date value.
        Parameters:
        date - the date value
        Returns:
        the date value's time component or a time value representing midnight if the date value does not have a time component
